skill.name: pydicom
skill.description: Python library for working with DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine) files. Use this skill when reading, writing, or modifying medical imaging data in DICOM format, extracting pixel data from medical images (CT, MRI, X-ray, ultrasound), anonymizing DICOM files, working with DICOM metadata and tags, converting DICOM images to other formats, handling compressed DICOM data, or processing medical imaging datasets. Applies to tasks involving medical image analysis, PACS systems, radiology workflows, and healthcare imaging applications.

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and guidance skill for the legitimate pydicom medical imaging library. All 253 static findings are false positives: the scanner misinterpreted markdown code formatting (triple backticks) as shell backtick execution, DICOM transfer syntax identifiers (JPEG, JPEG2000 compression) as weak cryptographic algorithms, and documentation reference URLs as hardcoded network endpoints. The Python scripts perform standard medical imaging operations (anonymize, convert, extract metadata) with no malicious intent, no network operations, and no credential access.

content.user_title: Work with DICOM medical imaging files
content.value_statement: Process DICOM medical images including CT, MRI, X-ray, and ultrasound. Read, write, anonymize, convert, and extract metadata from healthcare imaging files.
actual_capabilities: Read and write DICOM files with full metadata access
Extract and manipulate pixel data from medical images
Anonymize patient health information (PHI) in DICOM files
Convert DICOM images to PNG, JPEG, TIFF, and BMP formats
Handle compressed DICOM formats (JPEG, JPEG2000, RLE)
Process multi-slice DICOM series for 3D reconstruction
limitations: Does not perform medical diagnosis or image interpretation
Requires appropriate handlers for compressed DICOM formats
Does not connect to PACS systems or hospital networks

use_cases.title: Prepare imaging datasets
use_cases.description: Anonymize patient identifiers and convert DICOM files for research and machine learning workflows.

use_cases.title: Convert and export images
use_cases.description: Extract and convert medical images from DICOM format to standard image formats for reporting.

use_cases.title: Build imaging pipelines
use_cases.description: Process large volumes of medical imaging data for AI model training and validation.

prompt_templates.title: Read DICOM file
prompt_templates.prompt: Read a DICOM file and show me the patient name, study date, modality, and image dimensions.

prompt_templates.title: Convert to PNG
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert a DICOM file to PNG format and normalize the pixel values for proper display.

prompt_templates.title: Anonymize PHI
prompt_templates.prompt: Anonymize a DICOM file by removing all patient health information including name, ID, and dates.

prompt_templates.title: Process series
prompt_templates.prompt: Read all DICOM files from a directory, sort them by slice position, and create a 3D volume array.

output_examples.input: Read a DICOM file and show me the key patient and study information
Convert a CT scan to a PNG image
Anonymize this chest CT DICOM file

best_practices: Always verify anonymization completeness before sharing medical data
Install compression handlers (pylibjpeg, gdcm) for JPEG/JPEG2000 DICOM files
Use proper windowing (VOI LUT) for correct CT and MRI image display
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill for clinical diagnosis without proper medical supervision
Do not share anonymized data without verifying all PHI has been removed
Do not assume all DICOM files follow the same structure - check for optional tags

faq.question: What DICOM modalities are supported?
faq.answer: All modalities including CT, MRI, X-ray, ultrasound, PET, and mammography are supported.

faq.question: How do I install compression handlers?
faq.answer: Run: uv pip install pylibjpeg pylibjpeg-libjpeg pylibjpeg-openjpeg python-gdcm

faq.question: Is anonymization reversible?
faq.answer: Basic anonymization replaces fields with placeholder values. Verify all PHI is removed before sharing.

faq.question: Can I process multi-frame DICOM files?
faq.answer: Yes, access frames via pixel_array[index] for video or multi-frame DICOM files.

faq.question: Does this connect to hospital PACS systems?
faq.answer: No, this skill only processes local files. It does not make network connections.

faq.question: What image formats can I convert to?
faq.answer: PNG, JPEG, TIFF, and BMP formats are supported for output.
